summary: The concept of "European regional organization," a redirect to the preferred term "European organisation," encompasses entities established to foster cooperation among member states within the EU framework. These organizations serve as platforms for scholarly exchange, enabling researchers, scientists, and engineers to attend sessions that promote excellence in various fields, including physics and industry. Their operability is benchmarked against established standards, ensuring that initiatives align with the ambitions of the EU. Chairpersons and scholars contribute to the exploratory nature of these organizations, while honoraria and funding mechanisms, such as those from ERC and EMI, support their activities. Ultimately, these organizations act as guarantors of autonomy and repute, fostering a seamless integration of ideas across Europe.
